verses.roman:
harer nāma-ślokera yei karilā vyākhyāna
sei satya sukhadārtha parama pramāṇa

synonyms: harer nāma-ślokera—of the verse beginning harer nāma harer nāma; yei—whatever; karilā—made; vyākhyāna—the explanation; sei—that; satya—true; sukha-da-artha—a meaning that is pleasing to accept; parama pramāṇa—the supreme evidence.
translation: "Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu's explanation of the verse beginning 'harer nāma harer nāma' is not only pleasing to the ear but is strong, factual evidence.
